channel.title: Help with server
channel.description:
I server is very weird. It sometimes is online then sometimes it does work.
Can you plz help me.

item.title: Help with server
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Please actually read the tutorials before making a server.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server
item.dc:creator: @ryebread8888 ryebread8888
item.description:
@ryebread8888 wrote:

[quote=“wales 00, post:8, topic:296016”]When you are port forwarding you have to enter a IP address in the firewall settings of the rounter (If you have not got a firewall settings it will be on port settings) similar to;

192.168.0.1

To find out if it has changed do;

start > cmd > ipconfig[/quote]
THANK u so much it works now!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server
item.dc:creator: @wales_00 wales 00
item.description:
@wales_00 wrote:

When you are port forwarding you have to enter a IP address in the firewall settings of the rounter (If you have not got a firewall settings it will be on port settings) similar to;

192.168.0.1

To find out if it has changed do;

start > cmd > ipconfig

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server
item.dc:creator: @ryebread8888 ryebread8888
item.description:
@ryebread8888 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:6, topic:296016”]Happened with me awhile ago. Look in your character files.
If you have a bunch of numbers 152-236-whatever, for your password, then don’t fret.
First, change your number password to something else. (Example: lol)
Then, make another account with the password you WERE using (Example: lmao). Then log out & in & out again with that new account.
Check the new account’s password. It should be all numbers. Copy the numbers, and change it to the other password you were using on the other account (lmao).
Lastly, on the first account, paste in the number mess, and try the password the other account has (try lmao, it should work.).

If it doesn’t Idk. That’s all I did, even though it sounds messy. :rolleyes:[/quote]
I dont have that

wales 00:

Your DNS may be updating every often, you will need to change the WAN IP in your router port allowance settings.

and i cant find it I have a linksys WCG200 ver.2 router

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

Happened with me awhile ago. Look in your character files.
If you have a bunch of numbers 152-236-whatever, for your password, then don’t fret.
First, change your number password to something else. (Example: lol)
Then, make another account with the password you WERE using (Example: lmao). Then log out & in & out again with that new account.
Check the new account’s password. It should be all numbers. Copy the numbers, and change it to the other password you were using on the other account (lmao).
Lastly, on the first account, paste in the number mess, and try the password the other account has (try lmao, it should work.).

If it doesn’t Idk. That’s all I did, even though it sounds messy. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
